question: What was the code-name of the Turkish military invasion of Cyprus in 1974?
explanation: Turkish military invasion of northern Cyprus on 20 July 1974 was code-named as Operation Atilla. Turkey launched the operation, with the help fo Turkish Cypriots, following the 15 July 1974 Cyprus coup by the Greek Cypriots. This operation was a clear cut victory for the Turkish military which established the self-declared internationally unrecognised de facto state in northern Cyprus named the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus; recognised only by Turkey. The Republic of Cyprus has de jure sovereignty over the entire island of Cyprus.
